pull.title: [qa] Ensure bitcoind processes are cleaned up when tests end
pull.body: When tests fail (such as due to a bug in the test, race condition, etc), it's possible that we could follow code paths that bypass our normal node shutdown that occurs in `TestNode.stop_node`.  Add a destructor to `TestNode` that cleans this up.

events.body:
I have been able to reproduce the issue of bitcoind processes living on after tests exit in a couple ways:
 * #12375: running wallet_encryption.py on macos fails and leaves a bitcoind running
 * the feature_dbcrash.py failure that should be fixed in #12902 does the same.

This PR causes all nodes to exit in both those situations.

> Should this heed --noshutdown?

@laanwj Oops, yes of course it should, will fix.

Seems reasonable. I don't think this can do any harm.

utACK ccc9031c69e67c336362b197c7decf14af98a877
Might have to set `self.process` to `None` in `feature_help.py`?

Tested ACK f1d91ef.

Using the instructions in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12902#issuecomment-379260451 with this change kills all test processes.

Code looks good, please squash.

events.message: [qa] Ensure bitcoind processes are cleaned up when tests end

events.body: Post-merge tested ACK on Windows e36a0c0

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -84,6 +84,13 @@ def __init__(self, i, datadir, rpchost, timewait, binary, stderr, mocktime, cove
 
         self.p2ps = []
 
+    def __del__(self):
+        # Ensure that we don't leave any bitcoind processes lying around after
+        # the test ends
+        if self.process:
+            self.log.info("Cleaning up leftover process")
comments.body: Looks like the log is flushed and closed when the tests are done, so wouldn't work at this point.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -84,6 +84,13 @@ def __init__(self, i, datadir, rpchost, timewait, binary, stderr, mocktime, cove
 
         self.p2ps = []
 
+    def __del__(self):
+        # Ensure that we don't leave any bitcoind processes lying around after
+        # the test ends
+        if self.process:
+            self.log.info("Cleaning up leftover process")
comments.body: Odd, I was able to see this logging work when I tested locally.  Will remove.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -84,6 +84,13 @@ def __init__(self, i, datadir, rpchost, timewait, binary, stderr, mocktime, cove
 
         self.p2ps = []
 
+    def __del__(self):
+        # Ensure that we don't leave any bitcoind processes lying around after
+        # the test ends
+        if self.process:
+            self.log.info("Cleaning up leftover process")
comments.body: Yes, it appears that logging *can* work after calling `logging.shutdown()`, but the documentation states that no calls to logging *should* be made after shutdown: https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.shutdown
